title: So, more mana regen nerfs.
body:
You continue to shit on mages (many of whom are immobile) while directly and indirectly buffing their resourceless brethren (most of whom are quite mobile). 75 mana, great! Thanks for that! That will help someone, in some situation, at some time! 

 Balance where?

 "mana gate should mean something" Well, resourcelessness should have tradeoffs too. Why are only one of these "rules" being adhered to?

 Continue forcing the mages to support, which gets them nerfed again (for reasons). This all seems to be leading up to simply deleting the mage class. Care to stop twirling your mustache for a second and explain what the fuck is going on, Riot? Why are you shitting on mages so hard when they USED to be almost reasonably balanced against the resourceless assassins plaguing mid?
 ~Uiru

Seriously.  I don't know what Riot has against Ziggs and Sona, but they are nowhere near as oppressive as Riot believes they are.
Sona is actually pretty damn strong. A good sona, mid or bot, is actually oppressive. However, good luck not dying being one of the squishiest things to ever exist.

Damage =/= oppressive
Tanky =/= oppresive

Extreme damage + safety = oppressive.

Sona lacks the safety, sustain, and crowd control to be oppressive.

I genuinely don't understand the stance toward mages at the moment.  Mana seems to me to be in a really bad spot right now (specifically in regards to magey mid-laners).  If you don't have a mana regen or mana conservation mechanic, you stand virtually no chance of actually winning your lane reasonably well against someone like Zed.   And now they're nerfing it even more.  I take 3 points in this mastery on virtually every mid, and it gives you 2-4 extra spells in lane.  that is actually a MASSIVE deal when you're going up against the energy/resourceless champions in mid lane right now.  

It actually makes me think they're preparing to do another pass on the base mana regen values of mid laners and maybe up it a bit.   Is that just wishful thinking?  Everything I've seen in regards to mana this season has been to reduce it's effectiveness.  There has to be some sort of legitimate compensation buff, no?
Yes, that's actually specifically why I added "legitimate" in that sentence, haha.  "Compensation buff" is spoken in hushed tones on these boards.

War is peace

I thought about the items that would be improved on Shen, but the fact of the matter is that you're wasting a lot of gold over nothing. 

Shen does not have enough of an offensive base for Tear to ever be useful and right now you can buy Rylai's on Shen if you want HP/AP, so you'd gain nothing from RoA. 

Few champs actually buy Frozen Heart and IBG for the Mana; their other stats are far more important. They're like TriForce in that regard - just because they have mana does not mean they lack cost efficacy.

Really though, it comes down to my not wanting a Shen rework. I like the way he plays. I like that he can feel both balanced and strong. If they need to help his Energy issues, then they can do to him what they do to nearly every other Energy-user and give him an effective Energy refund mechanic.

I also enjoy the way that he plays, but his ap ratio's are redundant.. his problem now is that he's barely balanced, especially compared to his counterparts.. I'm not sure what the bold means, care to explain? Do you mean that his AP ratios are mostly pointless and make him weaker? 

All of Shen's counterparts are Assassins though - he is the only true Tank. As far as Akali having higher defensive base stats, you don't see people building Tank Akali as a result. While I agree they should give Shen Scaling MR (because a lot of tanks deserve it), keep in mind that Akali's damage is not increased by building tanky - Shen's damage increases by building HP. Riot has to keep this aspect in mind when designing Tanks vs. Assassins. While Akali's defensive base stats scale, she typically won't build any or enough defensive items to make her unkillable defensively - her strength comes from spellvamp and resets from kills. Meanwhile, Shen builds straight tank to perform an entirely different function on his team and his damage increases as well. 

Frankly, comparing the two is not that great simply because they pan out differently throughout the game, perform different functions for their teams and build differently.

When mana less champions like Zed/Katarina have better wave clear, better roam and mobility out push champions like Lux and Syndra you know there is a BIG problem. There is no reason to pick Syndra or Lux over Zed or Katarina because of the aforementioned strengths that Zed and Katarina have. These two champions need to have their health regen as low as Riven's. There is no reason why these two major offenders (Zed and Katarina) should have waveclear, 1v1 kill pressure, manaless and high natural sustain. Natural sustain by way of hp regen needs to be nerfed heavily for these specific champions. There already is a large balance gap between mages and Assassins, this mana regen change will further that gap. Also a PSA, Zed and Kat weren't nearly as much of an issue towards the end of season 4, but when the balance team decided to gut mana regen across the boards, Zed and Kat became unkillable nightmares in the mid lane. This problem REALLY needs to be addressed.

Like someone else stated,  there needs to be a trade off for the resourceless champions.  Mana champions are limited to a number of spells that can be used and requires better judgement as to not run out of Mana and die.  Resourceless champions has no trade offs, they have low cool downs, spam skills and can be overly oppressive in lane.
